intro: Melothria cucumis, commonly known as the sour sop or custard apple, is a tropical fruit-bearing plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces a large, spiky fruit with a thick, yellow or green rind and a soft, creamy interior filled with a sweet and tangy pulp. The fruit is often used in culinary applications, beverages, and traditional medicine due to its unique flavor and nutritional properties. Its growth is typically favored in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil.
